    • Constructor Detail

      • UserRepository

        public UserRepository()
        Stand-in class for a database of users that would be used by actual applications. Implements all needed database operations for this log-in application, such as retrieving data (potentially with filters), creating data, and deleting data.

    • Method Detail

      • resetUserData

        public void resetUserData​(java.util.List<java.util.Map.Entry<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String>> adminUserData,
                          java.util.List<Triplet<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String,​java.time.LocalDateTime>> basicUserData,
                          java.util.List<Triplet<java.lang.String,​java.time.LocalDateTime,​java.lang.String>> eventData,
                          java.util.List<SerializedWallet> walletData,
                          java.util.List<SerializedArt> artData,
                          WalletManager walletManager,
                          ArtManager artManager)
        Given lists of user and event data, populate the empty user HashMap with users, and events related with said users.
        Parameters:
        adminUserData - list of admin-user data in username -> password key-value pairs.
        basicUserData - list of basic-user data in (username, password, banUntil) Triplets.
        eventData - list of event data in (related user, datetime, type) Triplets.
        walletData - a SerializedWallet
        artData - a serializedArt
        walletManager - a WalletManager instance
        artManager - an ArtManager instance

      • getByUsername

        public java.util.Optional<User> getByUsername​(java.lang.String username)
        Attempt to get a user (SELECT) by username from the hashmap of users.
        Parameters:
        username - the username of the user intended for retrieval.
        Returns:
        the retrieved user, or null, if the username has no corresponding user.

      • getAllUsers

        public java.util.List<User> getAllUsers()
        Get all users stored in the hashmap of users.
        Returns:
        a list of all stored users.

      • getAllUsersByType

        public java.util.List<User> getAllUsersByType​(boolean isAdmin)
        Get all users of a provided type from the hashmap of users.
        Parameters:
        isAdmin - do you want to retrieve all admin users (if not, return all non-admin users)?
        Returns:
        all users of the specified type.

      • createUser

        public void createUser​(User userToCreate)
        Store a specified user in the user HashMap.
        Parameters:
        userToCreate - user to be stored.

      • removeUser

        public void removeUser​(User user)
        Remove a user from the user HashMap
        Parameters:
        user - user to be removed.
